New Records: Zack Wheeler recorded his franchise record-breaking 11th consecutive start of 6.0-plus innings and two-or-fewer earned runs allowed.
Wheeler racked up 11 strikeouts, moving him past Chris Short for seventh-most double-digit strikeout performances in Philadelphia Phillies' franchise history.
Key Match Events: Zack Wheeler tossed 6.1 innings against the Washington Nationals, allowing just three hits, two walks, and two earned runs.
Reliever Jeff Hoffman collapsed in the eighth inning, allowing four runs, leading to a 6-3 victory for the Nationals.
Post-Match Reflections: The Phillies' decision to extend Wheeler's contract in March looks increasingly smart as he continues to deliver dominant performances.
Wheeler is contending for the NL Cy Young Award, although he is expected to finish behind Chris Sale.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Philadelphia has one more game against Washington on Sunday before the regular season ends.
The Phillies will wait to see which opponent emerges from the NL Wild Card Series for their playoff run.
